title: 2002 World Championship of Ski Mountaineering
text:
The 2002 World Championship of Ski Mountaineering () was the first <a href="World%20Championship%20of%20Ski%20Mountaineering">World Championship of Ski Mountaineering</a> sanctioned by the <a href="International%20Council%20for%20Ski%20Mountaineering%20Competitions">International Council for Ski Mountaineering Competitions</a> (ISMC), held at <a href="Serre%20Chevalier">Serre Chevalier</a> in the former French province <a href="Dauphin%C3%A9">Dauphiné</a> from January 24 to January 27, 2002. In due to the heavy snowfall all events were postponed one day
The event was supported by the <a href="F%C3%A9d%C3%A9ration%20fran%C3%A7aise%20de%20la%20montagne%20et%20de%20l%E2%80%99escalade">Fédération française de la montagne et de l’escalade</a> (FFME). The 230 participants were from 22 nations and from three continents. Compared to the 1975 <a href="Trofeo%20Mezzalama">Trofeo Mezzalama</a>, which was also held as "World Championship of Ski Mountaineering" with the classes "Civilians", "Soldiers" and "Mountain guides", the ICSM competition was only for members of the civilian national squads. Participants from countries without a squad could register with the help of the national mountain organizations.
